abstract.text: Indicates the display type. Must be one of the following enum values:  -
Leaves the HTML where it is in the document. This allows for adding a label or presenting on a separate page. -
The HTML in the section may be expanded or collapsed. By default, the section is expanded. -
The HTML in the section may be expanded or collapsed. By default, the section is collapsed. -
Converts the section into a responsive table. Note that this style is applied only on HTML tables that fall within the `startAnchor` and `endAnchor` positions. -

Converts the section into a responsive, single-column table. Note that this style is applied only on HTML tables that fall within the `startAnchor` and `endAnchor` positions. The table is converted to a single column in which each column becomes a row and is stacked. -
Prevents this portion of the HTML from displaying in the responsive signing view.
These properties define how a Smart Section displays. A Smart Section is a type of display section.
Indicates the display type. Must be one of the following enum values:  -
Leaves the HTML where it is in the document. This allows for adding a label or presenting on a separate page. -
The HTML in the section may be expanded or collapsed. By default, the section is expanded. -
The HTML in the section may be expanded or collapsed. By default, the section is collapsed. -
Converts the section into a responsive table. Note that this style is applied only on HTML tables that fall within the `startAnchor` and `endAnchor` positions. -

Converts the section into a responsive, single-column table. Note that this style is applied only on HTML tables that fall within the `startAnchor` and `endAnchor` positions. The table is converted to a single column in which each column becomes a row and is stacked. -
Prevents this portion of the HTML from displaying in the responsive signing view.
